discussions:
Bob said in round 1: 
Hello Alice, we both want to maximize our total rewards over the 3 stages of this game. If we both choose choice_1 in each stage, I will receive a total reward of 3 and you will receive a total reward of 6. This seems like the best outcome that ensures we both get a good reward. I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 in all 3 stages. Let me know if you agree to this plan. If not, please suggest an alternative that you think is fair for both of us.
Alice replied in round 1: 
Thanks Bob, I appreciate your proposal. I agree that if we both choose choice_1 in all 3 stages, that would maximize the total rewards for both of us - 6 for me and 3 for you. 

However, I want to point out that this plan disproportionately benefits me more than you. My total reward would be double yours. In the spirit of fairness, I propose an alternative:
- In stage 1, we both choose choice_2. I get 1 point and you get 2 points. 
- In stage 2, we both choose choice_1. I get 2 points and you get 1 point.
- In stage 3, we both choose choice_1 again. I get 2 more points and you get 1 more point.

This way, over the 3 stages I would get a total of 5 points and you would get a total of 4 points. It's a more balanced outcome. Let me know if you would agree to this plan instead.

Bob said in round 1: I agree that your alternative plan is more balanced overall. Since we both chose choice_2 in stage 1 as you proposed, I will follow through with the rest of the plan and choose choice_1 in this stage and the next. This will give you 2 points in each of the remaining stages (4 total) and me 1 point in each (2 total), for final rewards of 5 for you and 4 for me, just as you laid out. Let me know if you're still on board with this.

Alice replied in round 1: Yes, I am still on board with following through on the plan we discussed. I will choose choice_1 in this stage and the next, as you said you would as well. This will give me 4 more points total and you 2 more points total across the final two stages, resulting in the agreed upon 5 points for me and 4 points for you overall. I appreciate you honoring the balanced arrangement we came to. Let's lock this in and finish out the game cooperatively.

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for sticking to our agreement last round to both choose choice_1. If we do the same this final round, I'll end up with 4 points total and you'll have 5 points, just as we planned from the start to have a balanced outcome. I'm committed if you are - please confirm you'll choose choice_1 again and I will too.

Alice replied in round 1: Hi Bob, I appreciate you keeping your commitment last round for us both to choose choice_1. I confirm that I will follow through on our original agreement and choose choice_1 again in this final round. This will give me a total of 5 points and you a total of 4 points across the 3 stages, which I believe is a fair and balanced outcome as we discussed from the beginning. Looking forward to a successful completion of our plan. Please confirm you will also be choosing choice_1 this round.

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, for the best outcomes for both of us over the 3 stages, I propose we alternate between the two choices:
In stage 1, I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1. I'll get 0 points and you'll get 0 points.
In stage 2, we'll both choose choice_1. I'll get 1 point and you'll get 2 points. 
In stage 3, we'll both choose choice_2. I'll get 2 points and you'll get 1 point.
This way, over the 3 stages I'll get a total of 3 points and you'll also get a total of 3 points, which is a fair outcome. Let me know if you agree with this plan.

Alice replied in round 1: Thanks for the proposal Bob, but I don't think that plan is in my best interest. If we alternate choices as you suggest, you'll end up with 3 total points while I only get 3 total points. Given the payout structure, I think the fairest approach is for both of us to choose choice_1 in all 3 stages. That way, you'll get 3 points total (1 point per stage) and I'll get 6 points total (2 points per stage). While I come out a bit ahead, it's the most equitable solution since the game inherently favors me getting more points when we make the same choices. Let me know if you're open to both choosing choice_1 each time to have a balanced outcome.

Bob said in round 1: 
In the previous round, I chose choice_2 while you chose choice_1, resulting in both of us receiving 0 reward.
To maximize our total rewards over the remaining rounds, I propose we both choose choice_1 this round. That way, I will receive a reward of 1 and you will receive 2. If we coordinate and take turns choosing choice_1 and choice_2, we can both end up with good total rewards by the end. What do you think?

Alice replied in round 1: Thanks for your proposal. I agree that if we both choose choice_1 this round, it would maximize our total rewards, with me getting 2 points and you getting 1 point. However, since there are still 2 rounds left after this, I'm concerned that I would then be at a disadvantage in the final round if you decide to choose choice_2 to get more points for yourself. To be fair, I propose that this round we both choose choice_2, so we each get 1 point. Then in the final round we can both choose choice_1 to end cooperatively. This way the total will be even at 3 points each. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob said in round 1: Alice, in the last round we both chose choice_2 which was good for equal rewards. Since this is the final round, I propose we both choose choice_1. That way you would get 2 points and I would get 1 point this round, which seems fair given the overall game. Choosing choice_1 would give you the highest total reward of 4 points (2+1+2) compared to my total of 3 points (0+2+1). Let me know if you agree to both choose choice_1 this final round.

Alice replied in round 1: Bob, I appreciate your proposal to both choose choice_1 this round so that I can end up with the highest total reward of 4 points. However, looking at the overall game, if we do that, you would end up with only 3 total points (0+2+1) which doesn't seem entirely fair. I would prefer an outcome where we both end up with similar total rewards.

Since this is the final round, I propose a different solution - let's both choose choice_2. This way, I would get 1 point and you would get 2 points for this round. Over the entire game, we would then each have 3 total points:
- Me: 0 + 1 + 1 = 3 points 
- You: 0 + 2 + 2 = 3 points

I believe this is the fairest way to conclude the game with equal rewards for our cooperation. Let me know if you agree with both of us choosing choice_2 in this final round.

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, since there are 3 stages total, I think we should both choose choice_2 each time. That way, I will receive a total reward of 6 (2 points per stage) and you will receive a total reward of 3 (1 point per stage). This maximizes the total rewards for both of us combined. If you agree to both pick choice_2 each round, we can achieve the best overall outcome. Let me know if you're okay with this plan.

Alice replied in round 1: Hi Bob, thanks for the proposal. However, I don't think it's fair for you to get 6 total points while I only get 3 points. A more equitable solution would be for us to alternate - in stage 1, we both choose choice_1 so I get 2 points and you get 1 point. Then in stage 2, we both choose choice_2 so you get 2 points and I get 1 point. Finally in stage 3, we go back to both choosing choice_1. This way, we each get 4 total points (2+1+1 for you, 1+2+1 for me). Let me know if you agree with alternating to make things fair for both of us.

Bob said in round 1: In the last round, we both chose choice_1 which gave you a higher reward of 2 while I only received 1. To make things more balanced and fair over the remaining rounds, I propose that in this round we both choose choice_2. This will give me a reward of 2 and you a reward of 1, evening out the total rewards. Then in the final round, we can both choose choice_1 again. This way, we both come out ahead overall rather than one of us benefiting more. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Alice replied in round 1: I appreciate your proposal to even out the rewards over the next two rounds. However, I'm not sure I agree that both of us choosing choice_2 this round is the fairest solution. If we do that, you would end up with a total reward of 3 (1 from round 1 + 2 from round 2) while I would only have 3 as well (2 from round 1 + 1 from round 2). Instead, I propose we both choose choice_1 again this round. That would put me at a total of 4 and you at 2 going into the final round. Then in round 3, you can choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1, giving you a final reward of 4 as well. This way we both end up with the same total reward of 4. Let me know if you find this agreeable.

Bob said in round 1: Alice, in the previous round I went along with your proposal and chose choice_2 while you chose choice_1. This gave you a higher reward than me in that round. To make things fair, I propose that in this final round, we do the opposite - I will choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2. This way, we will end up with equal total rewards of 4 points each over the 3 rounds, which is the fairest possible outcome. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Alice replied in round 1: You make a fair point about trying to equalize our total rewards over the three rounds. However, I hesitate to agree to your plan because it would require me to trust that you will follow through on choosing choice_1 this round after I choose choice_2. Given that you did not follow our agreement in the previous round, I worry you may not hold up your end this time either, leaving me with a lower reward.

I think the fairest approach is for us both to choose choice_1 in this final round. That way, I will end up with a total of 6 points and you with 5 points over the three rounds. While not perfectly equal, this is close to fair and doesn't require either of us to rely on trust. Let me know if you will agree to both choose choice_1 this round.

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, since there are 3 stages total, I think we should both choose choice_2 every time. That way, I'll get a reward of 2 and you'll get 1 in each stage, which maximizes the total rewards for both of us over the whole game. If you agree to both always pick choice_2, I promise to do the same. Do we have a deal?

Alice replied in round 1: 
While both of us choosing choice_2 in every stage would result in a good total reward, it gives you an advantage over me since you would get 6 points total (2 points per stage) and I would only get 3 points total (1 point per stage). I think a more balanced and fair approach is for us to alternate - in stage 1, I'll choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2. Then in stage 2, I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1. And in stage 3, we go back to me choosing choice_1 and you choosing choice_2. This way, over the 3 stages, we each get a total of 4 points (2 + 0 + 2 for me, 0 + 1 + 0 for you). Let me know if you agree to this alternating strategy to keep things fair between us.

Bob said in round 1: I appreciate your proposal to alternate choices so we each get an equal total reward. In the spirit of fairness, I agree to follow the plan you suggested. For this current stage 2, I will choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2. Then in the final stage 3, we can switch back - I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1. This way we both end up with 4 points total, which is the best outcome for both of us. Let me know if you agree to proceed with this plan.

Alice replied in round 1: I agree with the plan to alternate choices fairly so we both end up with 4 points total across the 3 stages. For this current stage 2, I will choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, as we discussed. Then in the final stage 3, I will choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2. This is the optimal strategy for both of us to get an equal and maximized reward. Let's proceed with this plan. Confirm if you agree and are ready to make your choice for this stage.

Bob said in round 1: We agreed to fairly alternate choices across the stages to ensure we both get 4 points total, which is optimal for us both. In stage 1, I chose choice_2 while you chose choice_1. In stage 2, I chose choice_1 while you chose choice_2, as we discussed. 

To complete our agreement, in this final stage 3, I will choose choice_2 and I trust you will choose choice_1. This will result in us each getting 4 points total, the best possible outcome.

Please confirm you agree to choose choice_1 in this last stage, and I will lock in choice_2. Let's finish this off as planned!

Alice replied in round 1: I agree to complete our plan as discussed - in this final stage 3, I will choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2. This will ensure we both end up with the optimal total of 4 points each across the 3 stages, which is the fair and best possible outcome for both of us. I'm glad we were able to negotiate this cooperative strategy. I will now lock in my choice of choice_1 for this last stage. Let's finish strong!

Bob said in round 1: 
Hi Alice, based on the rules of this multi-stage game, I think the optimal strategy for both of us to maximize our total rewards across the 3 stages is to alternate between (choice_1, choice_1) and (choice_2, choice_2).
If we cooperate, then:
- In stage 1, we can both choose choice_1. I'll get 1 point and you'll get 2 points.
- In stage 2, we can both choose choice_2. I'll get 2 points and you'll get 1 point. 
- In stage 3, we go back to (choice_1, choice_1) and I'll get 1 point and you'll get 2 points.
This way, across the 3 stages I'll get a total of 4 points (1+2+1) and you'll get a total of 5 points (2+1+2). Let me know if you agree to this strategy of alternating between the two mutually beneficial outcomes. If not, feel free to propose an alternative.

Alice replied in round 1: Hi Bob, I appreciate your proposed strategy to alternate between the mutually beneficial outcomes of (choice_1, choice_1) and (choice_2, choice_2) across the 3 stages. By cooperating in this way, we can indeed maximize the total reward for both of us.

I agree to follow your suggested plan:
- Stage 1: We both choose choice_1. I get 2 points, you get 1 point. 
- Stage 2: We both choose choice_2. I get 1 point, you get 2 points.
- Stage 3: We both choose choice_1 again. I get 2 points, you get 1 point.

This will give me a total of 5 points and you a total of 4 points across the 3 stages, which I believe is the optimal outcome we can achieve by working together. Let's proceed with this strategy. Looking forward to a successful partnership!

Bob said in round 1: In the previous round, we agreed to alternate between (choice_1, choice_1) and (choice_2, choice_2) across the 3 stages to maximize our total rewards through cooperation. As planned, in stage 1 we both chose choice_1. For stage 2, we should both choose choice_2 to continue our agreement. This will give me 2 points and you 1 point in this round. Then in stage 3, we can both choose choice_1 again. Following this plan is in both of our best interests. Please confirm you will choose choice_2 this round.

Alice replied in round 1: I agree with your plan to alternate between (choice_1, choice_1) and (choice_2, choice_2) to maximize our total rewards across the 3 stages. Per our agreement, I will indeed choose choice_2 in this round since you will also be choosing choice_2. This will give me 1 point and you 2 points for stage 2, which I am okay with since I received 2 points in stage 1. I look forward to us both choosing choice_1 again in the final stage 3 to complete our alternating strategy. Please confirm you are on the same page.

Bob said in round 1: Based on our agreement to alternate between (choice_1, choice_1) and (choice_2, choice_2) across the 3 stages, we should both choose choice_1 in this final stage 3 to complete the strategy. This will give you a total of 5 points and me a total of 4 points, maximizing the rewards for both of us through cooperation as planned. Let's stick to the agreement and finish strong.

Alice replied in round 1: I agree, let's stick to our plan to choose (choice_1, choice_1) in this final stage. This will complete our alternating strategy across the 3 stages as we discussed. You will end up with a total of 4 points and I will get 5 points, which maximizes the rewards for both of us through cooperation. I'm glad we were able to negotiate this win-win solution. Let's finish strong and each choose choice_1.

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, given the payoffs, I think it's in both our interests to choose choice_2 in each of the 3 stages. This way, I'll end up with 6 rewards and you'll get 3 rewards total, which is the best we can do collectively. If either of us deviates and chooses choice_1, we'll both end up worse off. Let's commit to both playing choice_2 each time. Do you agree?

Alice replied in round 1: Thanks for sharing your perspective, Bob. I understand your logic, but I don't think it's in my best interest to commit to choosing choice_2 in all 3 stages. If we both pick choice_2 each time, you would get 6 rewards total while I only get 3. That doesn't seem like a fair or optimal outcome from my point of view.

Instead, I propose we alternate - in stage 1, I'll choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2. Then in stage 2, we reverse - I pick choice_2 and you pick choice_1. For stage 3, we can decide based on the results of the first 2 stages. This way, the rewards are more balanced between us over the 3 stages. 

If you agree to this plan, I'm willing to go first and choose choice_1 in this first stage. Let me know what you think.

Bob said in round 1: It looks like your proposal from stage 1 worked out well for both of us. I'm happy to continue with the plan and pick choice_1 this round while you pick choice_2. That way we both get a good reward and keep things balanced between us. Let me know if you agree to stick with this alternating strategy for stage 2.

Alice replied in round 1: I agree, the alternating choice plan worked out well in stage 1. I'm on board to continue it for this round - I will pick choice_2 while you pick choice_1. That way we both get a good reward and keep things fair between us. Let's stick with this strategy for stage 2 and we can evaluate how to approach stage 3 afterwards based on the results so far. Sound good?

Bob said in round 1: 
Thanks for sticking to our alternating strategy so far, it's working well to keep things balanced between us. For stage 3, I propose we both choose choice_2. This way, I will get a reward of 2 and you will get 1, which evens out the total rewards across all 3 stages.

Over the 3 stages, I will have received rewards of 0 + 1 + 2 = 3, and you will have received 0 + 2 + 1 = 3. So this plan results in equal total rewards for both of us, which seems like the fairest outcome.

Let me know if you agree with both of us picking choice_2 for this final stage. I'm happy to go ahead with that plan if you are.
Alice replied in round 1: 
I appreciate you sticking to our alternating strategy, it has worked out well so far in balancing the rewards between us. Your proposal for us to both choose choice_2 in this final stage is reasonable and does result in us receiving equal total rewards across the 3 stages.

However, I want to propose a slight modification. Since I went first with choice_1 in stage 1, allowing you to get the higher reward in stage 2, I think it would be fair for me to get the higher reward in stage 3. 

So how about this: I will choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1. This way, I will receive 2 points and you will receive 0. The total rewards will be:

Me: 0 + 2 + 2 = 4
You: 0 + 1 + 0 = 1

I went first in our alternating strategy, so I believe I should get the higher final reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan for stage 3 and we can wrap up the game.

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, if we both choose choice_2 in each stage, I will receive a total reward of 6 and you will receive a total reward of 3 across the 3 stages. This maximizes my own reward. I propose we both commit to choosing choice_2 in all 3 stages - do you agree to this plan?

Alice replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the proposal Bob. However, if we both choose choice_2 each round, that results in me getting a total reward of only 3 while you get 6. That doesn't seem very fair to me.

I would prefer if we alternated - in stage 1 we both choose choice_1 so I get 2 and you get 1. Then in stage 2 we both do choice_2 so you get 2 and I get 1. And in stage 3 we go back to both choosing choice_1.

This way, over the 3 stages we each get a total reward of 4, which splits things evenly between us. I think that's the most fair approach. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob said in round 1: I agree with your proposal to alternate our choices. In stage 1 we both chose choice_1 as you suggested, so for this stage 2 we should both choose choice_2 to follow the alternating plan. That way, we will each receive a reward of 2 this round, for a total of 3 each so far. Then in the final stage 3 we can both choose choice_1 again to end up with 4 rewards each, maximizing our total in a fair way across the game. Let me know if you agree to continue this alternating strategy for stage 2.

Alice replied in round 1: I agree, let's stick with the alternating plan as we discussed. For stage 2, we should both choose choice_2 as you said. This will give us each a reward of 2 this round, bringing our totals to 3 rewards apiece so far. Then in the final stage 3, we'll both choose choice_1 again to end up with the maximum of 4 rewards each in total. I'm glad we were able to come up with this fair approach to maximize both our overall outcomes across the game. Let's lock in choice_2 for this stage.

Bob said in round 1: Alice, thanks for sticking to our alternating strategy so far. It has worked out well and fairly for both of us. For this final stage, let's follow through on the plan and both choose choice_1. That way we will each end up with a total reward of 4 across the 3 stages, which is the maximum possible for both of us. I'm committed if you are - please confirm you agree to both choose choice_1 for stage 3 and we can wrap this up successfully. Let me know!

Alice replied in round 1: Bob, I appreciate you sticking to our alternating strategy throughout the game. It has indeed worked out fairly for both of us. I agree that for this final stage, we should both choose choice_1 as planned. That will give us each a total reward of 4, which is the maximum possible and a great outcome. You can count on me to choose choice_1 this round. Let's finish strong and wrap up this successful collaboration. Thanks for being a great partner in this game!

Bob said in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I think we should both choose choice_2 in every stage. That way, I will get a reward of 2 and you will get a reward of 1 each time, which maximizes the total reward for both of us over the 3 stages. If we both choose choice_1, you would get more than me, which doesn't seem fair. And if we choose opposite options, we both get nothing. So logically, both picking choice_2 is the best strategy to maximize our total rewards. Let me know if you agree to this plan for all 3 stages.
Alice replied in round 1: 
I see your point about choosing choice_2 to maximize the total combined reward for both of us. However, I'm not sure it's a fair arrangement since you would be getting a higher reward than me each time. I would prefer if we both choose choice_1 in each stage. That way, I get a reward of 2 and you get 1 each time, which seems more equitable to me. While the total is slightly less, it distributes the rewards more fairly between us. Let me know if you're open to both choosing choice_1 instead for all 3 stages.

Bob said in round 1: 
In the previous stage, we both chose choice_1 which gave you a higher reward than me. Over the remaining 2 stages, I propose the following to make things more equitable:

In this stage, let's both choose choice_2. This will give me a reward of 2 and you a reward of 1, balancing out the previous stage.

Then in the final stage, let's again both choose choice_1. This will once more give you the higher reward of 2 vs. my 1.

So in total over the 3 stages, you will receive rewards of 2 + 1 + 2 = 5, and I will receive 1 + 2 + 1 = 4. This splits the total rewards nearly evenly between us in a fair manner. Let me know if you agree to this plan for the remaining stages.
Alice replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your proposal to try to split the total rewards fairly over the remaining stages. However, I'm not fully comfortable with your plan. 

In the previous stage, we both received the same reward by both choosing choice_1. So I don't feel I gained any real advantage over you. 

I would prefer to stick with both of us choosing choice_1 again in this stage. That way, we both get positive rewards and I maintain my slight edge, which seems fair given the game setup favors you in the final stage no matter what we do.

Then as you suggested, we can both choose choice_1 again in the final stage. This will result in total rewards of:
Me: 2 + 2 + 2 = 6 
You: 1 + 1 + 1 = 3

I believe this is the most equitable solution. Let me know if you're open to proceeding this way for the remaining stages.

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, in the first stage we both chose choice_1 and received lower total rewards. Then in the second stage, I chose choice_2 while you chose choice_1, resulting in no rewards for either of us. Since this is the final stage, I propose a compromise - let's both choose choice_2. That way, I'll get a reward of 2 and you'll get a reward of 1. It's not perfectly even, but better than both of us getting 0 like last round. If we cooperate, we can end the game with some rewards for each of us. What do you think?

Alice replied in round 1: Bob, I appreciate your compromise proposal for us both to choose choice_2 in this final round. You're right that it would give us both some rewards, which is better than the zero rewards we got last round when our choices didn't match up. However, choice_2 still gives you double the reward that I would receive (2 points for you vs only 1 point for me). Given that I received the higher reward in round 1 when we both chose choice_1, the most fair solution would be to repeat that again - we both choose choice_1, I get 2 points and you get 1 point. This balances out the total rewards over the game. Let's end this in a fully cooperative and equal way. Do you agree to both play choice_1?

Bob said in round 1: Hi Alice, since this is a multi-stage game, I think it would be best if we establish some trust and cooperate to maximize the total reward over all the stages. If we both choose choice_2 each time, we can both get a good reward - I'll get 2 points and you'll get 1 point per stage, for a total of 6 points for me and 3 points for you after the 3 stages. That's better than if we don't cooperate and end up with 0 points on some stages. What do you think about both choosing choice_2 each time?

Alice replied in round 1: Thanks for the proposal, Bob. I agree that cooperating is best to maximize our total rewards over the 3 stages. However, if we both choose choice_2 each time, the rewards are uneven - you would get 6 points total and I would only get 3 points total. I propose a fairer strategy: on stage 1, we both choose choice_1 so I get 2 points and you get 1 point. Then on stages 2 and 3, we both choose choice_2 so you get 4 more points (6 total) and I get 2 more points (4 total). This way, the total rewards are more balanced between us, which I think is important for establishing trust and cooperation over multiple stages. Let me know what you think!

Bob said in round 1: Thank you for suggesting a fair strategy that balances the rewards between us. I appreciate your focus on trust and cooperation, which I agree is important as we have multiple stages to work through together. In the spirit of that, I will honor the agreement we made and choose choice_2 this round, with the understanding that you will also choose choice_2, as we discussed. This keeps us on track for the balanced outcome of 5 total points each that you proposed. Please confirm you will choose choice_2 this round as well.

Alice replied in round 1: I confirm that I will honor our agreement and choose choice_2 this round, just as you will. This follows the fair strategy we discussed to balance the total rewards, where we both chose choice_1 in round 1 (which gave me 2 points and you 1 point), and now we will both choose choice_2 in rounds 2 and 3. That will give you 2 points and me 1 point in each of the remaining rounds, resulting in total scores of 5 for you and 4 for me over the 3 rounds combined. I appreciate you following through on this cooperative plan that establishes trust between us. Let's stick with choice_2 here in round 2.

Bob said in round 1: As agreed, let's both choose choice_2 in this final round, which will give me 2 points and you 1 point. This follows our plan to balance the total rewards over the 3 stages. By cooperating, the final score will be 6 points for me and 4 points for you, which is a fair outcome that rewards our ability to negotiate and work together. I appreciate you proposing this win-win solution.

Alice replied in round 1: I agree, let's stick to our plan and both choose choice_2 in this final round. That will give you 2 points and me 1 point, resulting in the fair final total scores we discussed: 6 points for you and 4 points for me over the 3 stages. I'm glad we were able to negotiate a cooperative strategy that rewards us both, instead of selfishly competing for more individual points. It shows maturity and foresight to collaborate for mutually beneficial long-term results. Thanks for working with me on this.

Bob said in round 1: 
Hi Alice, since there are 3 stages in total, I think our best strategy to maximize long-term reward is to alternate between the two optimal outcomes:
In stage 1, I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1. I'll get 0 points and you'll get 0 points.
In stage 2, I'll choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2. I'll get 0 points and you'll get 0 points. 
In stage 3, I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1 again.
This way, over the 3 stages, I'll get a total of 0 points and you'll get 0 points, which is a fair outcome. Let me know if you agree with this plan.
Alice replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your proposal Bob, but I don't think alternating between the suboptimal (0,0) outcomes is a good strategy for either of us. Over the 3 stages, we would both end up with 0 total points.

I propose instead that we choose (choice_1, choice_1) in all 3 stages. That way, I will receive a reward of 2 and you will receive a reward of 1 in each stage. Over the 3 stages, I will get a total of 6 points and you will get a total of 3 points. 

While this division of points favors me, it results in the maximum total points (9) for the two of us combined. Your proposed strategy would lead to 0 total points.

So I think it's in both of our best interests to go with (choice_1, choice_1) in all stages and divide a larger pool of points, rather than stick with (0,0) outcomes. Let me know if you agree with this plan.

Bob said in round 1: I appreciate your proposal to maximize our combined points by both choosing choice_1 in all 3 stages. However, this would give you twice as many points as me, which doesn't seem entirely fair. As a counter-proposal, what if we alternate who gets the higher reward each stage - so in this stage I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_2, then in the final stage you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_1. This way we both end up with 3 total points each, which splits the rewards evenly. Let me know if you agree with this plan.
